definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Many of the papyri had not been read for over a thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 很多的紙莎草紙一千多年來都沒有被解讀。

sentences.english: The significance of these papyri finds can scarcely be over-exaggerated.
sentences.chinese: 發現這些蒲草紙的重要性怎麼誇張都難說過分。

sentences.english: A long torn twisted strip of papyrus, on which a column of Greek letters are written.
sentences.chinese: 一長條扭曲破裂的紙莎草紙，上面寫着一排希臘字母。

sentences.english: He is holding a partially rolled papyrus scroll in his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 他是持有部分滾動推出的莎草紙在他的左手。

sentences.english: The woman was moved by Hua. She gave the scratch paper to him.
sentences.chinese: 那位婦女被他感動了，把草紙還給了華羅庚。

sentences.english: Do you know the price of papyrus?
But I still prefer the paper.
sentences.chinese: 不過我還是更喜歡草紙。

sentences.english: Woollen cloth and timber were sent to Egypt in exchange for linen or papyrus .
sentences.chinese: 羊毛料和木材送到埃及以換取亞麻布或紙莎草紙。

definition: spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
consecutive serial numbers/chain (of supermarkets, hotels etc)/hyphen
lit. mandarin ducks playing in the water/fig. to make love
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
